line_1: Cold, pain-wrought drops his mournful face bedew!
line_2: Torn is his wretched mind! ev'n now I view

line_1: The drops that warm'd his heart bedew
line_2: To ALBERT'S breast an arrow flew,

line_1: Warms her cold cheek — his tears her cheek bedew.
line_2: He stays her fleeting spirit — life anew

line_1: And my cold hand with gushing tears bedew;
line_2: With eager fondness round my couch they drew,

line_1: Cold clammy drops I feel bedew;
line_2: Some Spaniard shuts thee from my view.

line_1: His forehead brown that glist'ning drops bedew,
line_2: His ruddy cheeks that wear their deepest hue,

line_1: As her soft tears the spot bedew.
line_2: Hope's patient smile shall wondering view;

line_1: The drops that warm'd his heart, bedew
line_2: To ALBERT's breast the faulshion flew —

line_1: While tears of joy her polish'd cheeks bedew.
line_2: Eugenio's face resumes a fresher hue;

line_1: Such shining drops my closing eyes bedew,
line_2: While I am absent from the sight of you.

line_1: And blood for blood these Indian plains bedew;
line_2: When Heav'n's unerring arm shall fall on you,
